intro: Gymnostachyum longispicatum, commonly known as the long-spined gymnostachyum, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its erect, woody stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, typical of many species in its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
